sentences.sContent: He whom I enclose with my name is weeping in this dungeon.
sentences.sContent_eng: He whom I enclose with my name is weeping in this dungeon.
sentences.sCn: 有人以我的名字被囚禁起来，正在地牢里哭泣。

sentences.sContent: So the Magician fell upon him, and beat him, and loaded him with chains, and cast him again into the dungeon.
sentences.sContent_eng: So the Magician fell upon him, and beat him, and loaded him with chains, and cast him again into the dungeon.
sentences.sCn: 于是魔术师又扑到他身上狠狠的打他，用链条把他锁起来，又把他扔到地牢里。

sentences.sContent: The first one was built in 642 and it contains the dungeon. As for the second one, it was built in the end of the 17th century.
sentences.sContent_eng: The first one was built in 642 and it contains the dungeon. As for the second one, it was built in the end of the 17th century.
sentences.sCn: 修道院包括了两座教堂，第一座建造于公元642年，其中包括了囚禁圣格利高里的地牢，而第二座则完工于17世纪末期。

trans.tranOther: a dark underground prison, especially under a castle, that was used in the past
